messages.content: What is the purpose of ComfyUI-NSFW-Detection?
ComfyUI-NSFW-Detection is designed to detect whether images generated by ComfyUI are Not Safe For Work (NSFW).
How is an image classified as NSFW by ComfyUI-NSFW-Detection?
It uses a machine learning model to classify images as either safe or not safe for work.
What action is taken if an image is classified as NSFW?
An alternative image is returned if the input image is classified as NSFW.
To install, clone the repo into the custom_nodes directory of ComfyUI location and then run pip install -r requirements.txt.
Which file contains the main functionality of ComfyUI-NSFW-Detection?
The main functionality of the project is encapsulated in the `NSFWDetection` class in the `node.py` file.
What parameters does the `run` method of the `NSFWDetection` class take?

The `run` method takes three parameters: `image` (the image to be classified), `score` (the threshold score for classifying an image as NSFW), and `alternative_image` (the image to be returned if the input image is classified as NSFW).
How can one contribute to the improvement of ComfyUI-NSFW-Detection?
Contributions are welcome. Users can submit pull requests with any improvements or bug fixes they have.
Is there any license associated with the usage of ComfyUI-NSFW-Detection?
Yes, this project is licensed under the terms of the MIT license.
